result.execSummary:
The defendant Elyse R Oppenlander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Defendant is to report to Probation within 72 hours of release from current incarceration.  Court will consider early termination of Probation after 2 years if all conditions have been met.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Cooperate with a Mental Health evaluation and follow through with treatment/counseling.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elyse R Oppenlander

defendant.name: Oppenlander, Elyse R

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Elyse R Oppenlander by video with attorney Chris Bailey in court.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.  

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 2 years) STAYED
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation.  Defendant to report within 72 hours of release from current incarceration.  Court would consider early termination of Probation after 2 years if all conditions have been met.
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Cooperate with a Mental Health evaluation and follow through with treatment/counseling.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 10, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant appeared by video

Defendant Elyse R Oppenlander by video, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey in court.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Defendant would like the soonest date available.  Court will allow defendant to appear by video for the plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Hearing on September 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel.
Hearing on August 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Follow through with treatment pursuant to conditions of current probation.

Defendant Elyse R Oppenlander in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses bail motion.  Arguments by the Defense.  No objection by the State.  Court grants defendant's motion to modify bail.  Court orders cash bond modified to a signature bond in the amount of $5,000.00.  Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 10:30 am.
